SENT.plain: The cytologic and histologic features of a rare case of small-cell carcinoma arising in Barrett's esophagus are reported
The patient presented with progressive dysphagia and an endoscopy revealed a distal esophageal mass with luminal constriction
The brushing smears showed small-cell carcinoma and dysplastic glandular epithelium
The concomitant biopsy confirmed the diagnosis of small-cell carcinoma arising in Barrett's esophagus
